Package imagingbook.lib.image

Class ImageAccessor.Scalar

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.image.ImageAccessor
      • imagingbook.lib.image.ImageAccessor.Scalar
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageAccessor.Byte, ImageAccessor.Float, ImageAccessor.Short
    Enclosing class:
    ImageAccessor
    public abstract static class ImageAccessor.Scalar
extends ImageAccessor
    The common (abstract) super-class for all image accessors to scalar-valued images. It inherits all methods from ImageAccessor but adds the methods getVal(int, int), getVal(double, double) and setVal(int, int, float) for reading and writing scalar-valued pixel data.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class imagingbook.lib.image.ImageAccessor

        ImageAccessor.Byte, ImageAccessor.Float, ImageAccessor.Rgb, ImageAccessor.Scalar, ImageAccessor.Short

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static ImageAccessor.Scalar create​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm)
      Creates a new image accessor of general type ImageAccessor.Scalar.
      float[] getPix​(double x, double y)
      Returns pixel value at the specified floating-point position as a float[] with either 1 for scalar-valued images and or 3 elements for RGB images.
      float[] getPix​(int u, int v)
      Returns pixel value at the specified integer position as a float[] with either 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
      float getVal​(double x, double y)
      Reads and returns the interpolated scalar pixel value for the given image position.
      abstract float getVal​(int u, int v)
      Reads and returns the scalar pixel value for the given image position.
      void setPix​(int u, int v, float[] pix)
      Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position.
      abstract void setVal​(int u, int v, float val)
      Writes a scalar pixel value to the given image position.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static ImageAccessor.Scalar create​(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip,
                                          OutOfBoundsStrategy obs,
                                          InterpolationMethod ipm)
        Creates a new image accessor of general type ImageAccessor.Scalar. The conrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image, i.e., ImageAccessor.Byte for ByteProcessor, ImageAccessor.Short for ShortProcessor, ImageAccessor.Float for FloatProcessor.
        Parameters:
        ip - the image to be accessed
        obs - the out-of-bounds strategy to be used (use null for default settings)
        ipm - the interpolation method to be used (use null for default settings)
        Returns:
        a new image accessor

      • getVal

        public abstract float getVal​(int u,
                             int v)
        Reads and returns the scalar pixel value for the given image position. The value returned for coordinates outside the image boundaries depends on the OutOfBoundsStrategy specified for this ImageAccessor.
        Parameters:
        u - the x-coordinate
        v - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        the pixel value (float)

      • getVal

        public float getVal​(double x,
                    double y)
        Reads and returns the interpolated scalar pixel value for the given image position. The value returned for coordinates outside the image boundaries depends on the OutOfBoundsStrategy specified for this ImageAccessor.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        the pixel value (float)

      • setVal

        public abstract void setVal​(int u,
                            int v,
                            float val)
        Writes a scalar pixel value to the given image position. What happens for coordinates outside the image boundaries depends on the OutOfBoundsStrategy specified for this ImageAccessor.
        Parameters:
        u - the x-coordinate
        v - the y-coordinate
        val - the new pixel value (float)

      • getPix

        public float[] getPix​(int u,
                      int v)
        Description copied from class: ImageAccessor
        Returns pixel value at the specified integer position as a float[] with either 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
        Specified by:
        getPix in class ImageAccessor
        Parameters:
        u - the x-coordinate
        v - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        the pixel value (float[])

      • getPix

        public float[] getPix​(double x,
                      double y)
        Description copied from class: ImageAccessor
        Returns pixel value at the specified floating-point position as a float[] with either 1 for scalar-valued images and or 3 elements for RGB images. Interpolation is used non-integer coordinates.
        Specified by:
        getPix in class ImageAccessor
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        the pixel value (float[])

      • setPix

        public void setPix​(int u,
                   int v,
                   float[] pix)
        Description copied from class: ImageAccessor
        Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position. The new value must be provided as float[] with 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
        Specified by:
        setPix in class ImageAccessor
        Parameters:
        u - the x-coordinate
        v - the y-coordinate
        pix - the new pixel value (float[])
